author: Special Correspondent
text:
District Collector S. Prabakar examines a printout generated by a Voter Verifiable Audit Paper Trail machine that will be used in Erode on Tuesday. —PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

The process of data deletion from VVPAT (Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail) machines began in the district on Tuesday.

A team from Bharat Electronics Limited will be deleting data in 386 machines transported from Bihar last month.

VVPAT machines will be utilised in Erode West segment in the district.

The machine to be kept in the display place will project for a few seconds the paper printout of the candidate the voter has chosen before it gets into the storage space.

Erode West is one among 17 constituencies in the State where the VVPAT machines will be utilised. The machines will be installed in all the 285 polling booths.
title: Data deletion from VVPAT machines begin
